table.entry: Captain Richard Browne listed two bay stoned horses with blacke maynes and tayles their riders George and Charles Rowly armed with Carabynes pistols [?bufcoates?] great saddles and swords

Edward Lole of St Katherines by the Tower woodmonger [?Inroled?] a dunne horse w[i]th a starr and [?snipp?] and one [?Iron?] gray horse their Riders Thomas Lovell and Edward [?Alcott?] furnished w[i]th Carabines pistolls buffe Coat great sadles and swords46
John Bury of the Starr in Fish streete hill gerdler enrolled one Roane gelding Joseph Wallington his Rider armed w[i]th Carabine pistolls buffe Coate great sadle and sword25
John Waterton and William Babb of Wapping enrolled one bay horse w[i]th a starr in his forhead his Rider William Bartlett armed w[i]th Carabine pistolls buffe coate great sadle and sword18
Jacob de Liere of Canning streete merchant enrolled one bay gelding his Rider William Worrall armed w[i]th Carbine pistolls buffe coate great sadle and sword250
John Tayler of Wappinge Shipwright enrolled one black geldinge Robert Everett his Rider armed w[i]th great sadle buffe Coate Carabine Case of pistolls and sword25

Thomas Pride of Pye Corner haberdasher registered one browne horse with three whyte feete and a white [?down?] his face John Wells his Rider armed w[i]th a Brest Back headpeece and gauntlett a Carabine and Case of pistols
Heriott Washburne of St Helens mercer enrolled one grey horse Thomas Washbourne his Rider armed w[i]th Carabine Case of Pistolls headpeece Brest Back and gauntlett
Captain Robert Manwaringe enrolled one Iron grey horse his Rider John Riland armed w[i]th a Buffe Coate a Carbine a Case of pistolls and a sword3000
Captaine Edward Harvy enrolled one very able Bay horse Joseph Withers his Rider furnished w[i]th a Buffe Coate a Carabine, a Case of Pistolls sword and great Sadle3600
Thomas Lewes of Bishopsgate Woodmonger enrolled one bright bay horse w[i]th a white downe his face John Canon his Rider, armed w[i]th a Buffe Coate, a Carabine a Case of pistolls and sword2000

Richard Pym of the Bull in B[isho]ppsgate streete Inholder listed one browne bay horse w[i]th a white foote behind his Rider Randoll Carter armed w[i]th a Carabine, a Case of Pistolls a head peece Backe Brest and gauntlett2200
John Hollyday of the Crosse Keyes in Grace Church streete Inholder registered one white gelding, Robert Parry his Rider furnished w[i]th a Buffe Coate, a Carabine, a Case of Pistolls and a sword2200
William Willoughby of Wapping wall registred one black horse w[i]th a starr in his forehead his Rider Moses Bennett armed w[i]th a Buffe Coate a Carbine a Case of pistolls and sword3000

M[aste]r Richard Gibbs of Foster lane goldsmith enrolled one bay stoned horse w[i]th a starr in his face and a snip and one bay gelding w[i]th a starr and a white slip their Riders Abraham Bateman and Robert Shillitay both armed w[i]th buffecoats Carbines pistolls and swords5300
Thomas Argent of the Anchor in Friday streete girdler enrolled one faire blacke geldinge his rider John Bendall [?armed?] w[i]th a case of pistolls a Carbine a buff Coate and [?sword?]2400

NathanyellTolly of Pettycoate lane goldwyerdrawer listed one bay geldinge w[i]th a white starr and a slip on his face his Rider Christopher Shaw furnished w[i]th a Carabine a Case of Pistolls a buff Coate and a sword250
Thomas Walker of Dowgate haberdasher registered one grey gelding his Rider George Ward furnished w[i]th a Carabine a Case of Pistolls a headpeece Backe and Brest220

Captain George Tomson enrolled one grey geldinge two bay horses one other bay horse w[i]th a starr in his forehead one other bay horse w[i]th the like marke and one Iron gray horse their riders furnished w[i]th Carabines Cases of pistolls buffe Coats and swords The said horses and Armes valued at 22 [pounds] le peece one w[i]th another amountinge in toto to13200
Richard Hunt of Beerebinder Lane Comfit maker enrolled one bay gelding w[i]th a starr in his forehead his Rider George Clare armed w[i]th a buffe Coate a Carabine a Case of Pistolls and a sword230
Josias Primate of Fleete streete Letherseller entred one bay gelding w[i]th a starr, his Rider armed w[i]th a Buffecoate a Carabine a Case of Pistolls and a sword1810
George Day of the Angell in Cheapside haberdasher registred one bay gelding his Rider Richard Man furnished w[i]th a Carabine a Case of pistolls a Corslett headpeece backe and brest220

Benjamin Goodwynn of the Katherin wheele in Grace church streete Linen Draper enrolled one bay horse w[i]th a Blase in his fore head John Robinson his Rider armed w[i]th a Buff Coate a Carabine a Case of pistolls and a sword2300
Richard Rogers and Edward Underwood of Bucklersbery grosers registered one browne bay horse his Rider John Parcell furnished w[i]th a Carabine a Case of pistolls a Buffe Coate and a sword160

The right hon[or]able Philip Lord Wharton Lord Baron of Wharton enrolled six horse vi[delice]t fower browne bayes w[i]th whites in their foreheads, one bay geldinge and one sorell geldinge their Riders Henry Guilford, Thomas Atkinson, Robert Darby, Henry Savage, Leonard Saykild and William Parker all armed w[i]th headpeeces backes and brests Carabines and pistolls the said horse and Armes valued one w[i]th another at 28 [pounds] - 10 s[hillings] le peece amountinge in all to17100
John Alford of the three Leggs in Cheapside Clothworker enrolled one grey gelding his Rider Richard Jones armed w[i]th a Carabine, a Case of pistolls, a buffe Coate, and a sword2300
Samuell Boseley of Boe lane Clothworker enrolled one Fleabitten grey geldinge his Rider Francis Rosset furnished w[i]th a Buffe Coate a Carabine a Case of Pistolls and a sword2200
Mathew Apletree of Friday streete haberdasher entred one blacke geldinge w[i]th a white foote behind his Rider John Apletree armed w[i]th a right buffecoate, a Carabine and Case of Pistolls2100
John Browne of the Golden Fleece in the old Chainge m[er]chant Tayler entred one Dunn gray geldinge his Rider Thomas Fockett armed w[i]th a leathercoate a Carabine a Case of Pistolls and a sword2000

Abraham Gardiner of London bridge Fishmonger listed one bright bay geldinge w[i]th two white feete and a white in his forhead his Rider Thomas Cooper armed w[i]th a Carbine a Case of pistolls great sadle buffe Coate and sword2000
Thomas Cooke of Forster Lane goldsmith enrolled one grey geldinge his Rider Augustine Dudly armed w[i]th a Carabine a Case of pistolls great sadle, buffe Coate, and sword2400

John Hambden esq[uire] a member of the house of Comons listed two browne bay horses w[i]th white strakes downe their faces and one able grey geldinge their Riders armed w[i]th Carabines Cases of pistolls, buffe Coates and provant swords the said horses and Armes valued at 24 [pounds] le peece one w[i]th another amounting in all to7200
John Fenton at North doore of Pauls Clothworker listed one bay geldinge his Rider William Bough armed w[i]th a Case of pistolls a Carbine a buffe Coate and a sword2400

Walter Boothby of Aldermanbury m[er]chant enrolled one grey and one bay horse their Riders Armed w[i]th Carbines pistolls buffe Coats and swords the said grey horse and armes valued at 27 [pounds] and the bay and his Armour valued at 23 [pounds] amounting in all to5000
James Hubland of Beerebinder lane m[er]chant entred one able bay geldinge his Rider James Dandoe armed w[i]th a Carabine a Case of pistolls, buffe Coate and sword2200
Richard Brigginshaw of Popes head Ally Cutler enrolled one bay geldinge his Rider Thomas Page armed w[i]th a Carabine a Case of pistolls a Buffe Coate and a sword1800

M[aste]r William Penoyer of great St Helens m[er]chant enrolled ten horses vi[delice]t one blacke horse, one sorell horse, one bay horse w[i]th a star in his forhead, one able gray horse, one lesser bay horse one other able sorell horse w[i]th a white face, one other black horse w[i]th a white face, one grisly horse w[i]th a white face, one bay geldinge and one gray gelding their Riders furnished w[i]th great sadles and furniture only w[hi]ch said horses and furniture are valued by the Comissaryes one w[i]th another at 15 [pounds] le peece, amountinge in all to15000
John Alford of the three leggs in Cheapside Francis Pochin Clothworker listed one gray gelding his Rider Armed w[i]th a Case of pistolls a Carbine a buffe Coate and a sword2200

Lewes Younge of the George in Thamestreete Brewer listed one bay horse w[i]th a white snip and three white feete his Rider John Walker armed w[i]th a Carbine case of pistolls a headpeece backe and brest2100

Danyell Forvecke of Boe Lane weaver and Cittizen of London registered two geldings the one grey the other bay their Riders armed w[i]th buffe Coates Carabines pistolls and swords the grey horse and Armes valued at 28 [pounds] the Bay and his armes at 18 [pounds] in toto4600
John Charles of Colmanstreete Brewer this day enrolled one gray horse his Rider Walter Cooper armed w[i]th a Case of pistolls a Carabine, a Backe, Brest, headpeece gauntlett and sword2200

John Ellis of Cambridge Clarke and Will[ia]m Woodly of Fulum in the County of Cambridge yeom[an] entred one bay horse w[i]th a starr in his forhead and snip in the nose his Rider Edward Clarke furnished w[i]th a Case of pistolls, a Carbine Backe Breast headpeece and sword2500

William Perpoint in Chancery Lane esq[uire] enrolled two gray horses the one gelt the other stoned their Riders Thomas Hayse and Robert Laurence armed w[i]th Carbines pistolls buff coats and swords the said horses and Armes valued by the said Comissaryes at 26 [pounds] le peece in all5200

John Crew of Kingsgate in Holborn esq[uire] registered fower horses vi[delice]t one sorell and one browne bay horse w[i]th white in their faces, and two gray geldings their Riders John Freeman, John Hackwell, Will[ia]m Boswell, and armed w[i]th Cases of pistolls Carabines, buffe Coats and swords valued each horse and Armes one w[i]th another at 30 [pounds] le peece, amounting in all to12000

John Greate of the Crowne in Redcros streete Brewer enrolled two bay horses, their Riders Abraham Teyler and Roger Bridges, armed w[i]th Carabines pistolls Backes Brests and headpeeces one of the said horses and armes valued at 34 [pounds] the other at 26 [pounds] in all6000

John Wild of Sergiants Inn esq[uire] Sergiant at law listed one gray gelding and one bay horse their Riders Owen and John Granger armed w[i]th pistolls Carabines, buffe Coats and swords each horse & armes valued at 24 [pounds] in all4800

Captaine William Underwood of Bucklersbery listed two bay horses, one w[i]th a white in his face, their Riders himselfe and Henry Mathewes, armed w[i]th pistolls Carbines buff Coats and swords each horse valued at 23 [pounds]4600

S[i]r William Waller of the Charter house Kn[igh]t entred foare bay horses w[i]th starrs in their foreheads, their Riders John Chaunler, James Chester, Thomas Ward and Thomas Cooper, armed w[i]th Carabines pistolls buffe Coats & swords each horse and Armes valued one w[i]th another at 26 [pounds] le peece amountinge in all to10400

Edward Renicke one of Lord Maiors Officers entred one very faire gray horse w[i]th a white face, his Rider Augustine Walbancke furnished w[i]th a Carbine Case of pistolls head peece, breast, backe, and sword4000

Arthur Evelinge of the Strand esq[uire] enrolled two blacke horses w[i]th white in their faces, their Riders armed w[i]th Buffecoats Carabines pistolls and swords valued at 24 [pounds] le peece amountinge in all to4800

Edmond Peisly of St. Laurences Lane grocer Registred two geldinges, the one bright bay w[i]th two white feete, the other gray w[i]th a white face, their Riders John Baker and Bennett Ivett armed w[i]th buffecoats Carabines pistolls and swords the said gray horse and Armes valued at 28 [pounds] and the bay w[i]th his Armes at 25 [pounds] in all amountinge to5300

Thomas Waring and Francis Lee of St. Laurences Lane haberdashers Registred one able bay horse w[i]th a whiteface and three white feete, his Rider Richard Salter armed w[i]th Carabine Case of pistolls buffe coate and sword2600

Francis West of Breadstreete esq[uire] Registred fower horses vi[delice]t two bright bayes and one browne bay stoned, also one bay geldinge, their Riders armed w[i]th buffe Coates Carabines pistolls and swords The said horses and Armes valued by the Comissaryes one w[i]th another at 24 [pounds] le peece in all amountinge to9600
Richard Crawly of the greene Dragon at St. Laurences lanes end Registred one gray horse his Rider Richard Bowen armed w[i]th Carabine Case of pistolls buffe coate and sword2200

The right hon[or]able Henry Earl of Holland Registred thirty faire horse and geldings, their Riders Mr John Greene Thomas Rawlins David Vaughan William Morley Clement Bradshaw Thomas Armstronge Richard Man Edmond Blackwell John Johnson Roger Ball Thomas Tucker Josephe Harper John Cotton John Ellis John Nicholls, Ralph Blades John Everard Thomas Dowde Richard Pigott Edward Shepard Richard Dalpin Will[ia]m Jones Edmonde Wright John Carwarden, Zachary Jeninges Samuell Langhan Robert Austen, Richard Danbye Henry Buckson and John Mathews all armed w[i]th Cases of pistolls buffe Coates and swords. Each horse and Armes valued by the Comissaryes at forty pounds le peece one w[i]th the other amountinge in all to120000

The right hon[or]able the Earl of Essex Registred Twenty horses their Riders Edward Putsey John Fouks John Ward Richard Silvester Robert Gibbon, Christopher Estbrook John Bach Francis Well, Robert Wenslow George Allicocke John Britton, Henry Kirke William Goodridge Richard Dunn Thomas Waughton Edward Langford Israell Croxton John Knight Edward and William Cobald armed w[i]th pistolls headpeeces backs brests and swords all valued by the Comissaryes at 28 [pounds] le peece each horse and Armes in all56000

The right hon[or]able the Lord viscount Mandevyle Registred tenn horse their Riders Charles Alexander James Larke Thomas Price Samuell Sturly John Baseley Robert Massye Foulke Blincon Richard Coprace Gyles Davison and John Sturly, all armed w[i]th Carabines pistolls headpeces backs and brests valued by the Comissaryes each horse and Armes at 38 [pounds] le peece one w[i]th another in toto38000

George May of Iremonger Lane gent one of the fower Attur[nies] or Clarkes in the Lord Maiors Court London Registred one able gray geldinge, his Rider Henry Burgesse armed w[i]th a Carbine Case of pistolls buffe Coate and sword2400

William Williamson Paintersteiner enrolled one bay horse and one sorell gray geldinge, their Riders Samuell Lewes and Edward Lampheere armed w[i]th Carabines pistolls buffe Coats and swords each horse and Armes valued at 24 [pounds] le peece in all amountinge to4800

page.p: Wee whose names are herunder written p[er]sons no[m]inated by the Com[m]ons house of Parliament, appointed by an Order to be Comissaryes for viewinge and valuinge the horses and Armes p[ro]vided and raised in the said County Doe Certifie that the p[er]sons herunder no[m]inated have brought in horses accordinge to the p[ro]posic[i]ons of both houses of parliam[en]t for p[ro]vidinge horses horsemen and Armes. Which horses are valued as followeth vi[delice]t

entry.horses: one horse w[i]th sadle and bitt

page.p: Totall of horses 63 All w[hi]ch above menc[i]oned horses and riders upon them were mustered and listed and assigned to Collonell Arthur Goodwyn for his Troope Thursday the 11th August 1642. In witnesse wherof wee the Com[m]issaryes appointed as aboves[ai]d have hereunto subscribed our names Tho[mas] Sanders: Tho[mas] Westall

page.p: Civit Glouc The severall horses herunder menc[i]oned have ben listed and valued by the Com[m]issaryes of the Citty of Glocester and this 16th day of September 1642 Delivered unto Captaine Robert Kyrle by us Deputy Lieuten[a]nts whose names are subscribed &c

M[emoran]d[um]: This day George Lowe esq[uire] one of the members of the hon[or]able house of Com[m]ons entred one Darke graye geldinge Which geldinge the said M[aste]r Lowe hath freely given to the use of the Parliament and Kingdom accordinge to his subscription in the house of Comons, the 30th: of December last past for xx [pounds]2000

page.p: Horses sent in by severall men whose names are underwritten to the right hon[or]able the Lord viscount Say and Seale for the use and service both of Kinge and Parliament

page.p: Theise horses were brought in upon the Subscription, and were [?valued?] by John Luchocke, George Blunt, and Anthony Leycester and received by me W[illia]m Say & Seale

page.add: hitherto goes the fifth wast booke

page.p: This Booke containeth three thowsand seaven hundred Fiftye seaven horses geldings and mares, with what Armes was listed with them, the value of all which (according to [th]e sev[er]all enteries before goeing) doth amount to Fiftye fower thousand seaven hundred seaventye fower pownds Eighteen shillings foure pence, whereof wee discharge our selves as followeth in [th]e dischardge of our whole Accompt John Smythe Tho[mas] Richardson Comissaries
The 26th of Aprill 1644 M[aste]r Smyth & M[aste]r Richardson deliv[er]d this accompt upon their oathes Tho[mas] Hodges Rob[er]t Ellis
25 July 1650 The above said Thomas Richardson made Oath to [th]e truth of this Acco[mp]t Before us Henry Robinson Will[iam] Maddison
4 Dec[ember] 1651 The above named John Smyth this day made Oath to [th]e truth of this Acco[mp]t Before us Ri[chard] Wilcox Jo[hn] Greensmyth

This Booke conteineth the account of all the horse listed as Dragooneeres by the Comissary in London, most of them being brought uppe together with lists of their valuacons from the Deputye Lieueten[a]nts of sev[er]all Counties

[?listed?] for Dragoones, many whereof were [?brought?] uppe with lists of their valuac[i]ons from [?the deputye?] lieuetenannts of sev[er]all Counties and were entred with us and ticketts by us d[elivere]d accordinglye

page.p: A list of horses and Mares sent by the sev[er]all Townes in the p[ar]tes of Holland and Countie of Lincolne hereafter menc[i]oned, as they were sev[er]ally vallued by the Maior of Boston and two Aldermen the seaventh day of November 1642 and sent to Northampton for the Lord Generall

page.p: The number of horses conteined in this Booke doe amount to Twoe thowsand foure hundred Eightye Eight Their value according to the entries in this Booke doth amount to 9875 [pounds] - 13 s[hillings] - 02 [pence] All which horses [?etc?] conteined in this booke wee dischardge our selves of as by a p[ar]ticuler anexed contayning a dischardge of our whole Accompt John Smythe Tho[mas] Richardson Comiss[aries]
The 26th Aprill 1644 M[aste]r Smyth & m[aste]r Richardson deliv[er]ed this Accompt upon their oathes Tho[mas] Hodges Rob[er]t Ellis
25 July 1650 Jurat Coram Henry Robinson Will[iam] Maddisonn
4 Dec 1651 The above named John Smyth this day made Oath to [th]e truth of this Acco[un]t Ri[chard] Wilcox Jo[hn] Greensmyth

I know John Baldwin of Watford to bee an honest man; that he really listed a wagon & two horses for the supply of the Earle of Essex his army in their necessity after Edgehill fight: and that in that extremity Daniel Marvel & John Gray were deputed Com[m]issaries for that present, that it might bee certaynely knowne what was really lent & to what values. This I testify this 9th of Febr[uary] 1649 C Burges

These are to Certifie all whom it maie concerne, that about October 1642 Daniell Fountaine of Wingrave in the Countie of Buck[ingham], did voluntarily send in one Horse; for the service of the Parliamente w[hi]ch was imployed for a while in Captaine Ingoldsby his Troope, but the said Captaine giveinge over his Troope, the said horse, about 15 November 1642 (amongst others) was delivered to the Comissaries in Moorefeild & by them valued (to the best of my remembrance) at Five poundes, date this 21th of December A[nn]o D[omi]ni 1649: Ri[chard] Grenvile

November the 2: 1642 John Baldwine of Harrods in watford listed two horse one A bay with A starr in the forehead the other A browne bay with Two whit feet with Harnis to them valued att 9 [pounds] Daniell Marvill John Gray Comishoners
Horse and Armes listed under sev[er]all Captaines of the Cittye of London, chiefely for the defence of the said Cittye by the Comissaries

idemCapt[ai]n Willet brought one dunn gelding w[hi]ch was freely given to the State by M[aste]r Draper of Edmonton and deliv[er]ed back to the said Captaine Willett by order from M[aste]r Corbett, being taken upp by the said M[aste]r Drap[er] att Kenton Battell
idemDaniell Hill att the horse shooe in Grace Church streete Merchaunt tayler, listed one fleabitten gray gelding900
Capt[ai]n WillettNathaniell Cock merchaunt listed one black browne horse with a snipp on his nose1500
idemMartin Hadricke of Strettam gent listed one able browne bay gelding with a starr, with a sadle and furniture1500
idemHenry Polsteed the younger haberdasher, listed one Iron gray gelding bare1200
idemJohn Diss of London gent listed one bay gelding with a blase and a white foote behinde800
idemEdward Alstone of Pantlowe in the County of Essex Minister, listed one gray fleabitten gelding with a rawe nose bare800
idemGeorge Boldero of Ipswich Merchaunt listed one browne bay gelding w[i]th one white foote & a snipp on his nose bare1200
Colonell HarveyM[aste]r John West of Enfeild, listed one black paceing geldinge furnished Compleate2500
idemHenry Grindell Inholder listed one bay horse w[i]th a starr600

Capt[ain] Harvey This day Capt[ain] Edmond Harvey as appertaininge to himselfe & some of the Inhabitants of Cornehill ward London Registered theise horses and Armes which were valued by Com[m]issaryes as followeth vi[delice]t one sad browne geldinge his Rider Armed with a Carabine a Case of pistolls a buffe Coate & a sword valued at 22 [pounds] one bright bay geldinge Armed ut ante valued at 26 [pounds] one bay bald horse with two white feete Armed as above valued at 26 [pounds] one browne gelding armed as above valued at 28 [pounds] one browne horse with a starr armed as above valued at 24 [pounds] one bright bay horse armed as above valued at 25 [pounds] one Iron gray horse armed as before valued at 24 [pounds] one black horse with a white face armed as above valued at 28 [pounds] one bay horse with a blase armed as above valued at 24 [pounds] one blacke horse with a starr and two white feete Armed as above valued at 24 [pounds] one browne stoned horse armed as above valued at 30 [pounds] one browne bay horse Armed as above valued at 32 [pounds] & Eight Carabines, eight paire of Pistolls Eight buffe Coates & Eight swords and Eight saddles and furniture beinge Armes & furniture for Eight men which hee wanted all which Armes & furniture was valued at 80 [pounds]39300

page.p: This Booke conteines hitherto 459 horses all which with their furniture listed with them respectively were deliv[er]ed as followeth vi[delice]t
Totall nomber of Horses contained in this Booke is 459 which were delivered as followeth vi[delice]t

ul.li: to sev[er]all others by warrant from his Excellence as by [th]e Gen[er]all Accompt appears 7

page.p: John Smythe Tho[mas] Richardson Comissaries
The 26th of Aprill 1644 M[aste]r Smyth & M[aste]r Richardson deliv[er]ed this accompt upon their oathes Tho[mas] Hodges Rob[er]t Ellis
25 July 1650 Jurat coram Henry Robinson Will[iam] Maddisonn
4 Dec 1651 The above named John Smyth this day made Oath to [th]e truth of this Acco[mp]t Ri[chard] Wilcox Jo[hn] Greensmyth
